purpose.p: This part of ISO 10303 specifies an application module for the representation of the information needed to describe properties of an electrical physical phenomenon. This physical phenomenon property may be a simple instance or a composition of many simple instances.

aa.refpath: composite_signal_property_relationship <= property_definition_relationship property_definition_relationship.relating_property_definition -> property_definition {property_definition property_definition.name = `composite signal property'}

composite_signal_property_relationship <= property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_object {characterized_object characterized_object.description = `aggregate operation'} characterized_object => external_definition

signal document_reference_item = signal document_reference_item <- applied_document_reference.items[i] applied_document_reference <= document_reference {document_reference document_reference.source = `signal category'} document_reference.assigned_document -> document <- document_usage_constraint.source document_usage_constraint {document_usage_constraint document_usage_constraint.subject_element = `signal category'}

property_definition (property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_object characterized_object => signal {signal classification_item = signal classification_item <- applied_classification_assignment.items[i] applied_classification_assignment <= group_assignment group_assignment.assigned_group -> group {group.description = `signal property category'} group => signal_category}) (document_reference_item = property_definition document_reference_item <- applied_document_reference.items[i] applied_document_reference <= document_reference document_reference.assigned_document -> document <- document_usage_constraint.source document_usage_constraint {document_usage_constraint document_usage_constraint.subject_element = `signal property category'})

property_definition <- property_definition_representation.definition property_definition_representation property_definition_representation.used_representation -> representation representation.items[i] -> representation_item => compound_representation_item => table_representation_item
property_definition property_definition.definition -> characterized_definition characterized_definition = characterized_object characterized_object => signal
